entry.title: 7TFT
entry.author: djtoll
entry.description_fr:
7TFT est un Theme cree pour les petit ecran TFT (voiture, Xbox, écrans portables ...). Il fonctionne aussi avec les résolutions 1080i !
Commentaire: Skin idéal pour un Car Media Center avec Xbmc comme celui que j'ai dans mes cartons. L'apparence est particulière mais extrêmement bien pensée. L'OSD est une réussite magnifique.
entry.description_en: 7TFT is an special XBMC skin for mini TFT´s (Car, xbox additive LCD´s - or portable screens) It works with 1080i reselution also ! :) Special features of the skin are the big headlines/fonts and the 4 corners control. Each menu has its own color, (Music -> green, Vodeo -> Blue, Picture -> yellow, Programms -> Pink)

entry.title: Aeon
entry.author: Duncan Harris
entry.description_fr:
Un projet Ambitieux, différent de tout ce qu'on a pu voir et qui fait école, réservé aux écrans Haute définition. En version Alpha pour le moment, le développement est très long, une première release stable étant prévue pour fin 2008 (j'ai quelques doutes sur cette date) Alliant une grande simplicité d'aspect pour l'écran principal à des vues hors normes pour les bibliothèques, Aeon est le genre de thème qui me fait dire qu'on touche à l'art dans la réalisation de l'aspect de Xbmc. Les images parlent d'elles mêmes. Aeon a aussi une fonction très intéressante, la possibilité d'utiliser la bibliothèque pour un type de vidéo et pas pour un autre, par exemple les films en mode bibliothèque et les Séries TV en mode fichier, cela peut être bien pratique pour des bibliothèques mal organisées. A mon avis cette fonction deviendra commune à tous les thèmes, en tout cas je l'espère. L'aspect peu commun peut perturber certains. Heureusement, la personnalisation des profils de Xbmc me permet de l'utiliser chez moi alors que les autres utilisateurs ne s'habituent pas à son ergonomie. Sans "Aeon Backpack" Aeon perd une bonne partie de ce qui fait son charme. Les deux sont indissociables. Aeon est encore jeune, itsaboy cependant son succès indéniable montre combien il est bien inspiré.
Avis Personnel: Je suis en admiration. Il est assez probable que j'écrive un article bien plus complet sur Aeon par la suite.
entry.description_en: An ambitous project, designed for HD screens, Aeon is very different from everything we have seen and now is a refrence!

entry.title: Back-Row
entry.author: Sharpe, djdafreund
entry.description_fr: Anciennement Front-Row, Back-Row est un Thème qui propose un grand nombre d'options, des modes de vues complètement inédits. Il est original, sympathique, drôle, customisable, perturbant, surprenant et j'en passe.
entry.description_en: Previosyly Front-Row, Back-Row is a skin with plenty of options, mod totally new. A must!

entry.title: Basics-101 Media Center
entry.author: Jezz_X, Mikebeecham
entry.description_en:
The Basics-101 skin is based on the graphics that Mikebeecham did for his Pandora skin mockups. (it uses its icons, its background image and color scheme). And they look great all credit to Mikebeecham for a great effort
!!!Please note this is not the Pandora skin.!!!
It is a skin that I intend to use as my main media center skin on Linux port of XBMC and is really only designed originally for media playback only not games play.
I took ideas from a few other skins that I have done or liked Its very xTV in style and also has a few touches of Vision thrown in for good measure (side bars and nav sounds)
This skin is for 720p 1080i only though I did include a basic Pal16x9 font file but the icon images look real blocky edges scaled down to that size . Its simple has no fancy view types (except Media Info) or Animations It has large readable font (xbox people may need to size it down a little it was meant for my 1360x768 rez of my TV that Linux full screen uses)
If you got the premade skins instead of from the SVN Ignore this. As I said it was made for Linux so by default there are no links to "Programs" section you will need to run Build_for_Xbox.bat if you want to use it on the xbox. Other wise run Build_for_Media.bat
!!! This skin has no KAI Stuff in it at all if you use KAI in XBMC pick another skin This one wont work for you !!!
It designed to be super mouse friendly (its for Linux remember) And has 1 Setting in the Settings Page side bar that will add some extra mouse features like moving the mouse over the right edge will open the shutdown menu (right click needed to close) and also while media is playing a hotspot will be in the middle of the bottom of the screen that will open Player Controls so you can FF RW Stop Pause etc... with the mouse. (right click needed to close)
I recommend that you up your icon cache to at least 384 anything smaller and list view looks pretty average. But again like I said its for Linux xbox might lag a little with that size cache.

entry.title: Fusion 3 HD (Stable version)
entry.author: Agathorn
entry.description_en:
Fusion for XBMC
"Its all about the media!"
Fusion is a new skin for the Xbox Media Center. The skin is designed to put the media in the spotlight, and makes the actual UI as minimal and unobtrusive as possible. Controls that you need to use infrequently are hidden away and only come into view as needed.
Fusion is designed, created, and coded by Agathorn, and is inspired and influenced by the Xephyr/Aeon, and Fluid skins.
Initial ALPHA Release --------------------- This is the initial release of the skin. At this point, very little is done and there are no doubt some bugs to be worked out in what has been done. This skin was made first and foremost for my own personal use. 99% of what I do with XBMC is TV and Movies, so that was the initial focus of the skin.
Currently skinned: Home screen Video Library, for TV Shows and Movies NTSC, PAL, and 720p only
Useage Guidelines ----------------- To access the menu in the Video Library, simply navigate to the left.
The video library is designed to be used with certain view types in certain places. If you toggle through the various views, you will find ones designed for TITLES (TV Show Titles), SEASONS, and EPISODES. Each is designed to be used at the appropriate level when viewing TV Shows. There are also three Movie (one in 720p) views called MOVIES, MOVIES 2 and MOVIES 3. Use whichever you prefer. The first view is all about showing the graphics and contains little information. Movies 2 includes much more detailed movie info at the loss of some graphics, and movies 3 is a combined view that really is the best of both worlds.
IMPORTANT USING MOVIES 3! This view isn't obvious at first. When using the view, you will see a long list of movies on the left and a larget movie poster of the selected movie on the right. If you navigate to the RIGHT you can access the scrollbar to page throgh movies faster. If you navigate RIGHT AGAIN, the movie poster will slide over covering the list of movies, and reveal detailed information about the movie you had selected.
720p NOTE: Due to the larger resolution and available screenspace in 720p, there is currently only one movie view, as it is able to present all the information neccesary.
Xephyr (AEON) Backpacks: Fusion was very much inspired by the Xephyr skin, now known as Aeon, and was designed to be able to use the backpacks from that skin on the home screen. Currently this is hardcoded, but I will be adding some customization in a later build. For now, if you wish to use them they must be located in the skin's MEDIA folder, and must be in folders named bg_movies, bg_tvshows, bg_pictures, bg_games, and bg_music.
Anything not skinned SHOULD fall back to PM3, however there are some odd places where even though I haven't touched the file/image, the fallback is buggy.
Known Issues ------------ If you enter the Video Library, but have nothing in the library (Library NOT file mode), then you may be unable to access the menu. This skin is really designed to be used in Library mode, but this will be fixed at some point. In the meantime if this happens to you, pressing LEFT TWICE _should_ get you to the menu where you can change to file mode. No promise though, and the file mode is not skinned properly yet.

entry.title: Skin Horizonz (Aeon) - Volume IV
entry.author: XB2IRIS
entry.description_en:
The new release of Horizonz skin (French)
Horizonz owes it's existence to the genius of Aeon and it's creator DJH_ who single handedly birthed a new skinning concept which so many XBMC users have come to love over the last few years.
This skin begun its rise as an Aeon Mod and has always continued to follow the principle of DJH_'s concept of elegance, efficiency and function. With DJH_'s skinning hiatis and Aeon's developemental progress considered unknown, Horizonz continued in its parent skin's wake by adding a new look interface, new simplistic views and a new generic concept called completeness. With Horizonz maturing by the day, the current feature potential has become endless, and with continued user based influence it has lept beyond it's label 'Mod' and greeted the XBMC community with a progressive skin bound only by the horisons of our minds.
Please readme for more information

entry.title: MediaStream
entry.author: Team Razorfish
entry.description_fr: MediaStream est un themes desormais incontournable, il a été créé autout du concept: "Le média est roi" Le support du format 4:3 a été ajouté dans la version 0.90, aussi si vous avez une Tv 4:3 assurez vous d'avoir une version de MediaStream posterieurs a 0.90.
entry.description_en:
MediaStream is a skin for the XBMC media center, which means that users of XBMC can download it and use it as an alternative to the default look and feel that comes with the media center. (If you would like to find out more about XBMC please visit xbmc.org). MediaStream has been designed around a central concept that "Media is King", in other words the reason you are using XBMC is to get access to your media and the skin should make that as simple (and as pleasurable) as possible.
WILL IT WORK ON MY 4:3 TV? Version 0.90 introduced 4:3 support, so ensure you use a version equal to or later than 0.90 with your 4:3 TV.
HOW DO I INSTALL IT? To install on your Xbox please unzip the downloaded Version and just copy the MediaStream folder to the skins folder within XBMC. Then activate via the Appearance settings within XBMC.
WHO CREATED IT? MediaStream was created by Team RazorFish.

entry.title: Project Mayhem III (PMIII) - Mods only
entry.author: ChokeManiac
entry.description_fr:
Skin vieillissant mais toujours préféré d'un grand nombre d'utilisateurs. (beaucoup ignorent même qu'il existe d'autres Thèmes) On peut espérer qu'un jour il subira une refonte complète. Ce skin sert souvent de base à ceux qui en développent de nouveaux. C'est en effet le moyen le plus simple de commencer un nouveau skin, en s'appuyant sur celui ci en guise de patron. Réaliser un Skin "From Scratch" demande une grande connaissance dans le domaine.
L'ergonomie est bien pensée car la simplicité est de mise. De plus la consommation mémoire est optimisée. Ce skin est toujours à la pointe des dernières avancées de Xbmc.
Textures + modification faites par Frost: - Beauté du Monde Jiraiya - Blue Light - KC - Orange - theme1 - OSX - Blue - Red - FC Bayern - XBMC - PlayBoy PM III (Adultes seulement only!!!) Note: PMIII n'est pas disponible en téléchargement ici, seuls des mods pour PMIII sont disponibles
entry.description_en:
PMIII is not available here, only PMIII mods are available for download
Textures + changes made by Frost: - Beauté du Monde Jiraiya - Blue Light - KC - Orange - theme1 - OSX - Blue - Red - FC Bayern - XBMC - PlayBoy PM III (Adult only!!!)

entry.title: Visor
entry.author: bobrooney_78
entry.description_en:
This is my little contribution to the amazing Xbox Media Center.
The skin is a port of Visor, a skin for myth-tv (www.mythtv.org), and is based on the great default XBOX MediaCenter-Skin.
Some graphics and ideas are taken from the excellent skins BlackBlue, Project Mayhem and HiFi.
Credits therefore go to
- just1nux and Ben Levitt (original visor-skin -> www.mythtv.org)

entry.title: Le Blog d'Alain Carraze
entry.author: Temhil
entry.description_fr:
Ce script vous permet de vous connecter sur le Blog d'Alain Carrazé (http://alaincarraze.blog.canal-plus.com) et de visionner les videos du blog ainsi que d'en lire leur description.
Depuis ses débuts en 1979 en tant que collaborateur de 'Temps X', l'émission de science-fiction, Alain CARRAZE à partagé ses passions pour le cinéma fantastique, les comics et surtout les séries TV à travers des émissions comme 'Fantasy' ( dans le cadre des 'Enfants du Rock' ) et principalement la cultissime 'Destination Séries', sur Canal Jimmy de 1992 à 2000 (pres de 225 éditions) , avec aussi des émissions spéciales comme le 'Marathon Friends', 'La Fête à Jerry Seinfeld', les Emmy Awards ou la 'Nuit Star Trek'. A travers des magazines, aussi, comme 'Esode, le magazine de la culture séries', des hors-séries pour Mad Movies ou 'Episodik'. A travers des livres, enfin, avec des ouvrages comme 'Le Prisonnier, chef d'oeuvre télévisionnaire', ou sur 'Chapeau Melon et Bottes de Cuir ', 'Mission: Impossible', 'Les Grandes Séries' et, récemment, la mini-encyclopedie 'Les séries télé' dans la collection 'Toute les Clés '. Il travaille sur des bonus de DVD ('Amicalement Vôtre', 'Le Prisonnier', 'Twin Peaks'), chronique aussi les séries à la radio et dans un grand quinzomadaire de programmes télé... et maintenant en exclusivité sur Canalplus.fr !
entry.description_en: This script allow to connect on Canal+ (French private network) blog: "Le blog d'Alain Carraze" - http://alaincarraze.blog.canal-plus.com - and watch videos of this blog and see description of it. FYI Alain Carraze is a french expert about TV show of which he is talking about in his blog. The interface as well all the videos on the blog are only in French.

entry.title: Navi-X (All Platforms)
entry.author: rodejo
entry.description_fr:
Navi-X est un navigateur de medias vous permettant de jouer des fichiers videos, audios, voir des images ou des fichiers textes. On peut comparer Navi-X a un navigateur Web excepté qu'il utilise des playlist au lieu de pages HTML. Comme pour lesp ages Web, une playlist peut-etre située n'importe ou sur le Web ou bien tout simplement localement sur votre Xbox.
Avec Navi-X i lest facile pour tous de creer des playlist sans avoir a s'y connaitre en prommation Pyhton. Les fichiers PLX (playlists) sont de simpels fichiers textes pouvant etre édités avec tout bon editeur de texte tel que notepad 9for ci-dessous pour le format). Comme pour les pages HTML, les playlists peuvent aussi contenir des liens vers d'autres playlists.
Vous pouvez avec Navi-X gerer et partager avec d'autres vos propres playlists. Par exemple un utilisateur peut créer une playlist et l'uploader sur un serveur Web. Ainsi tout changement fait dans cette playlist sera visible de tous immédiatement.
La page web de Navi-X se trouve a http://www.navi-x.org
entry.description_en:
XBMC script Navi-X is a media browser which allows you to browse and play video files, audio files, show images and shows text files.
Navi-X can be compared with a web browser but it uses PLX playlists files instead of HTML files. Like web pages PLX-files can be located anywhere on the internet but they can also be located locally on your Xbox.
Navi-X allows people to create their own playlists without having to know how to develop a Python script. PLX Playlist are simple text files and can be edited with any text editor like notepad (see below for the formatting). Playlist can also link to other playlist which is similar to HTML files.
Navi-X allows people to share and manage their own playlists. For example a user can develop a playlist and upload it to a HTTP server. Many people already have a personal website. Just upload the playlist to your website and share the link with others. Changes made to your playlists will be visible to others immediately.
The Navi-X homepage can be found at http://www.navi-x.org

En effet, il arrive que le script de méteo fonctionne mais pas les autres. Avec internet test vous pourrez savoir si xbmc à l'accès total au net et revoir votre configuration en fonction. Ca peut être utile pour voir si effectivement vos scripts ont accès au net.

entry.description_en:
This script is designed to allow you to edit simple text files on your XBox, without the hassle of an FTP transfer. I have made no improvements to the in-game keyboard, nor have I built in any support for USB keyboards (for all I know, they might work automatically--I don't have one, so I can't test). The XBox is NOT a particularly pleasant environment for editing text, so I don't recommend this script for writing the Great American Novel.
However, it will be an excellent resource for changing config file settings, or making small adjustments to Python scripts during development (tweaking the exact location of that ControlButton, or changing the timeDelay from 10 to 20, for instance).
Note: this version is compatible on all XBMC platforms even this it doesn't load in full screen in HD

entry.title: RunXM - New Install
entry.author: calvin8714
entry.description_en:
Extract the contents of either file to the XBMC/scripts folder of your XBMC installation, then run it to begin using this. In a new installation, you'll be prompted for a username and password, the upgrade installation will not overwrite your current login information.
Current features of RunXM: * Ability to create and edit the XM Radio Online username and password through the RunXM interface. * Listen to all Sirius/XM Radio stations available through their online streaming application through XBMC. * "About" window shows the running version of RunXM, and the last edited dates of XM Radio stations database and the RunXM script. * "Now Playing" window shows artist, song, CD title, CD image, and artist biography (when available).
Features planned for RunXM: * Check for an update through the interface.
Note: this version is for new Install only (it will overwrite your settings if you try to install it on an old one)
TIPS: - Set your "Unknown type Cache - Internet" cache to 0 or 256k. - When you first start playing a station, it will play for about 15 seconds, then freeze for about 15. Once it starts playing again it'll be fine for however long you keep playing it. I haven't found any settings to stop this from happening.
OPEN ISSUES:
- There are a few open issues around unescaping some of the song info - The Song Info from XM is not always perfect.

entry.title: MythBox
entry.author: analogue
entry.description_en:
What is MythBox? ================ MythBox is a MythTV frontend for XBMC.
It runs as a XBMC script (not a plugin) and has the following major features: - watch livetv - watch recordings (w/ comm skip) - schedule recordings
History ================ MythBox was forked from xbmc-mythtv (http://xbmc-mythtv.sourceforge.net) and heavily modified to bring MythTV protocol support up to date, add new features, and make MythTV a pleasure to use in XBMC (obviously, not there yet). Many thanks to all the developers whose time and effort went into the original xbmc-mythtv project!
Requirements ================ - XBMC Atlantis 8.10 running on 32bit Linux, preferably Ubuntu. Might work on Windows or Mac OSX (not verified but definitely a goal of this project). Won't work on XBox (sorry, I don't have one). - ffmpeg installed (sudo apt-get install ffmpeg) Needed to get frame rate for comm skipping to work. - python bindings for mysql (sudo apt-get install python-mysqldb) - MythTV recordings directory accessible via local filesystem (mount via nfs or samba before launching xbmc) - MythTV backend 0.21 or 0.22 (trunk)
Intallation ================ 1. Download mythbox.tar.gz to a directory of your choosing 1. cd ~/.xbmc/scripts 2. tar xzvf /path/to/downloaded/file/mythbox.tar.gz 3. Launch XBMC 4. Click on Scripts -> MythBox 5. Enter Settings, Click on Test until everything is OK and then Save Settings
First Milestone - ===============
GOAL ---------------- - Get most of the core functionality working. - Watching livetv - Watching recording + commercial skipping - Scheduling recordings - Defer complete overhaul of the GUI to future releases. - Usable enough to replace mythtv frontend for most tasks - Solicit feedback for changes/new features/etc.
DONE ---------------- - Recordings resume where you left off (mythtv bookmarks feature) - Replace logging subsystem. Mythbox specific logging goes to mythbox.log. - Commercial skipping (can be off a little if xbmc does not play video at framerate specified in mpeg file) - Support for commercial skipping via EDL skip files (broken in xbmc - TODO: Add issue # from trac) - MySQL 4.1+ client support - Switch over to the mysql python client that uses the native libmysql shared lib - 12 hour AM/PM time format for TV guide headers - Get LiveTV working - move generated images/thumbs to script_data/scriptname/images/thumbs - Remove mythtv_statusport, mythtv_startpage, mythtv_recplayer, mythtv_recordlive, mythtv_recordlength settings - Move settings.xml to userdata/script_data/script_name directory - Recording details screen thumbnail now respects image aspect ratio - Support for multiple recording directories (maps to MythTV recording groups) - Enable unit tests to be run w/o hardcoded config info (util.OnDemandConfig) - Remove use of singletons (singleton.py) - fix livetv/recorded tv player callback issue - induced GC so callbacks get unregistered - Added support for MythTV 0.22 (SVN trunk) - set mythtv_version_override in settings.xml - Fresh install works w/o an existing settings.xml - get a decect icon - TV Guide usable - LiveTV progress dialog
TODO -------------- - Fix scheduling recordings from TV guide - move tv channel icon thumbs to script_data/scriptname/images/channels - remove from svn - fix pyxcoder parsing failures on nuppelvids - Get settings via myth protocol instead of db - maybe..Samba support (so MythTV recordings dir doesn't have to be accessible via filesystem) - Get rid of settings for mythbackend hostname and port. These values can be queried from the settings tables as MasterServerIP and MasterServerPort - Would be cool to have an RSS feed of the latest MythTV news using RSS Feed control http://xbmc.org/wiki/?title=Controls#Available_controls - Would be cool to have playing video (mini version) on all screens if player is playing http://xbmc.org/wiki/?title=Controls#Available_controls - Configurable 'Confirm on Delete'
Future plans ============= - Complete re-write of UI to use WindowXML (skinners/gfx help needed) - Verify works on Windows - Verify works on MacOSX - Standalone python bindings for MythTV - TV show fanart scraper - MythTV RSS feeds
Development Changes ===================== - Unit tests rule (real time saver - especially for a dynamic language) - Dependency injection/IOC where possible - Mocking support (mockito rocks!) - Improve pydocs - Re-orged/renamed lot of stuff to follow AMT structure
What if it doesn't work? ========================== Grab the log file (~/mythbox.log) and open up a defect @ http://code.google.com/p/mythbox/issues/list.
A description of your setup and steps to reproduce are essential.
My ability to fix things depends in a large part on your ability to provide as much information as possible to isolate and reproduce the problem :-)
Additional nuggets of goodness: - Tweak log levels in ~/.xbmc/scripts/MythBox/mythbox_log.ini - Tweak settings manually in ~/.xbmc/userdata/script_data/MythBox/settings.xml
When is the next release coming out? ==================================== Subscribe to this RSS Feed and you'll be the first to know...
http://code.google.com/feeds/p/mythbox/downloads/basic
Contact Info ========================== Email: analogue@yahoo.com - Please put MythBox in the subject line.
Acknowledgements ================== Thanks to the folks at www.iconshock.com for the TV icon.
Enjoy!

entry.title: XBMC Earth
entry.author: MrLight
entry.description_en:
An amazing script created by MrLight XBMC Earth is now a Google Maps and a Microsoft Virtual Earth Client for XBMC. You are able to view the satelite, the hybrid and the street Map from both source GoogleMaps and also MS Virtual Earth. You can just browse through the map or you can search for a Location like a city or even for a service in a city. Like "Hamburg, Pizza" Since XBMC is a MediaCenter the script has some geotagged media features. You can search for Panramio, Flickr and Locr Pictures. Just browse the map to any location and then hit one of the Picture Services. The Result is shown on the Map as Thumbnails. To get some video inside of the script you can search for geotagged youtube videos. Just hit one of the resultvideos and the video is started. You can toggle between fullscreen and windowed. Sometimes the query results of youtube are really bad. So the video has no relevance to the selected place ;-((
The Webcams button brings Live content inside the script. Hit the Webcams button to see some Webcams of your area. To get a weather forecast for the shown area just hit weather.
How to use:
Controller: White Button: Toggle hybrid view; Map-View; Area-View; Sat-View Left-Trigger: Zoom out Right-Trigger: Zoom in back: Exit script
in Menu Map-Move: digiPad: Moves the Map back or A: back to Menu
Search: -Focus in List will pulse the selected marker on the Map -Select a List item will zoom to marker
Remote: Info Button: Toggle hybrid view; Map-View; Area-View; Sat-View 2 Button: Zoom out 1 Button: Zoom in back: Exit script
in Menu Map-Move: Arrows: Moves the Map back: back to Menu
Search: -Focus in List will pulse the selected marker on the Map -Select a List item will zoom to marker
Keyboard: ins Button: Toggle hybrid view; Map-View; Area-View; Sat-View Pg-dwn Button: Zoom out Pg-up: Zoom in ESC: Exit script
in Menu Map-Move: Arrows: Moves the Map ESC: back to Menu
Search: -Focus in List will pulse the selected marker on the Map -Select a List item will zoom to marker

entry.title: TimedLibraryUpdater
entry.author: rwparris2
entry.description_en:
Updates Video and/or Music Library at specific intervals (every 3 hours, for example) or at a specific time of the day (maybe 4:55 PM, right before you get off work) [The only part I've tested is setting a specific time to update, and only on Windows XP. Any feedback at the following link would be appreciated: http://xbmc.org/forum/showthread.php?t=39600]
Instructions: default.tbn from j3concepts http://j3concepts.deviantart.com/art/Porn-Needs-You-70255476 http://j3concepts.deviantart.com/art/Porn-Needs-You-70255476
Modify default.py with any text editor. Change this stuff:
#Number of HOURS between scans. Whole hours only, no decimals. #Use zero to only scan at a certain time (see below) hours_between_scans=0
#Time of day you want a daily scan to take place #Set hours between scans to zero "hours_between_scans=0" above to enable this. #Uses 24-Hour clock, so 8:00 AM is time=0800 and 1:00 PM is time=1300 time_to_start_scan=2129
#Choose which library to update. Options are #library_to_update="video" #library_to_update="music" #library_to_update="both" #don't forget the the quotes "" ! library_to_update="video"

entry.title: Hockey Streams

entry.description_en:
This plugin logs into http://hockeystreams.com, allows the user to enter a team, finds the game (HQ and HD links), and updates IP exceptions. Information is displayed on screen, and everything is controlled with buttons. There's no progress bars but everything appears on screen once finished processing, except team_name. It uses, mechanize, beautifulsoup, clientform, and clientcookie.
It is free, and not related to http://hockeystreams.com at all, all it does is access the site for the user.
Simply put, this makes HockeyStreams.com available directly from XBMC for Xbox!

entry.title: Radio Blug Club
entry.author: Frost
entry.description_fr:
Ce script vous permettra d'écouter de la musique de votre choix, que les utilisateurs du site Radio Blog Club partagent avec le site depuis leurs blogs ou d'une playlist sur un serveur X. Les chansons sont pas toujours disponibles, car si un utilisateur ferme son serveur pour un temps X, le site Radio Blog Club récupère qu'en même les infos sans que la chansons sois écoutable! Et le script aussi.
Donc, en gros faut faire une recherche d’un groupe ou le nom d’une chanson qu’on désire et même par genre car bien souvent il est écrit dans le titre. De la on choisi de la streamer ou de la télécharger. Certain reconnaitront le script étant l'auteur original et qui à été présenté en 2006 sur [gueux] avec quelque mise à jour. Mais la aucune mise à jour depuis juin 2007 avec l'aide de "nioc.bertheloneum" que je remercie encore.
NB: Parfois le streaming ne passe pas et le téléchargement oui !!! Vise Versas, aller savoir... NB2: Ne vous attendez pas à de la grosse qualité de mp3 il sont réencodés en basse qualité par le site pour des raisons légals.....
PS: Les recherches sont enregistrées dans un historique. Si l'historique commence à être trop longue, on peut la supprimer et même une par une. NB: Mon historique de recherche est incluse pour cette version

entry.title: Wixi Music
entry.author: runa
entry.description_en:
[B]WHAT'S WIXI?[/B]
[B]Upload and backup your media with no limits:[/B] Upload your media collections: photos, videos and favorite songs and also large document, spreadsheets, pdfs or zip files to your online desktop.
[B]Play files from anywhere[/B] Access your media files and playlists no matter where you are, just with an Internet connection, no need to carry any USB key or heavy hard-drive.
[B]Share it with your friends[/B] Your media files are meant to be shared: with your friends, family, colleagues or to the world! Send your media files and playlists to your friends ... even if they are not on Wixi!
[B]Mobile access to your media[/B] Wixi also works in the palm of your hand, with your mobile phone letting you search, play and download any public media file.
[B]Install and run Wixi[/B] First of all you will need a Wixi account (www.wixi.com). Wixi is available for pictures, music and video. You will need to go in each corresponding section of the Installer Passion-XBMC and install each plugin separately. Once installed, go in the section you wwant (pictures, music or video) and select Wixi plugin and display context menu. Then select Plugin Settings and type your user and password. Hit OK and then click on Wixi. Your folder structure will load and you will be able to enjoy your medias!

entry.description_en:
I've altered the xbmc-addons plugin to use for my personal favorite plugin, scripts and skins. I can't really lable it because all I did was alter the urls in the script and fix a bug (which is also present in the newest xbmc-addons version!). I'm updating the plugins/scripts/skins every week and thought other people might like the same additions to XBMC as I do. I might add some features to the plugin like "Install all" and/or "Update all addons present on your XBOX" when I find the time.
I thought I should at least share the option to other XBMC users, even though it was intended to be used for personal use. Not all plugins you'd like to see might be downloadable. You can suggest addons, but I can't guarantee I'll add them. I'll only add addons that are updated regularly and usefull to me and my fam.

I might add some features to the plugin like "Install all" and/or "Update all addons present on your XBOX" when I find the time.
I thought I should at least share the option to other XBMC users, even though it was intended to be used for personal use. Not all plugins you'd like to see might be downloadable. You can suggest addons, but I can't guarantee I'll add them. I'll only add addons that are updated regularly and usefull to me and my fam.

entry.title: XBMC Eyetv Parser
entry.author: prophead
entry.description_en:
XEP (XBMCEyetvParser) is a video plug-in for XBMC to view your Eyetv library from XBMC's video menu with the meta data, icons and thumbnails from Eyetv without eyetvsched files or the live tv buffer. 1) Installation A) XBMC http://xbmc.org/wiki/?title=Plugins#XBMC_for_Mac_plugin_directories http://xbmc.org/wiki/?title=Plugins#Adding_plugins_sources_in_XBMC_GUI Set your Eyetv directory by pressing 'c' for context menu on the XBMCEyetvParser plugin, then choose Plugin Settings
B) Boxee http://boxee-plugins.blogspot.com/2008/12/installing-plugins-for-boxee.html 1) Copy the XBMCEyetvParser directory to /Applications/Boxee.app/Contents/Resources/Boxee/plugins/video/ 2) 3) Run Boxee 4) Choose Settings 5) Choose add media source 6) Choose add application source 7) Choose XBMCEyetvScraper 8) Select Video and Private checkboxes 9) Hit ESC to back up to the settings menu 10) Choose Application Settings 11) Set your Eyetv Directory and TOG settings 12) ESC back to the main menu, the plugin is now ready to use 2) Use A) XBMC Select Eyetv from the videos menu Browse and select your video to play or hit 'c' to bring up the context menu and choose movie information to see full plot summary B) Boxee Select Eyetv from the video/Internet Sources menu Browse and select your video to play
3) Advanced Use A) TOG XEP (XBMCEyetvParser) now has integrated TOG (Thumbnail Overlay Generator) but it's disabled by default. To enable it hit 'c' to bring up the context menu on the plugin, then toggle TOG to on (Boxee users must choose to enable TOG in the settings>Application Settings>Eyetv dialog. Edit XBMCEyetvParser/default.py for your locations of the required Imagemagick and Ffmpeg, defaults are to the standard macports locations. To install these packages, first install macports, then from the terminal, sudo port install Imagemagick; sudo port install ffmpeg; The first time you use the XEP plug with TOG enabled it will take a while to generate the new (small size) thumbnails with overlays for your current Eyetv library. Subsequent use will be very fast due to preexisting XBMC .tbn files. Very small .tbn jpeg files will get created in your eyetv video packages, but it will not alter any original files, or impact regular Eyetv use in any way. If you would like to remove these files the easiest way to do this is from the terminal, find /path/to/eyetv/folder -name "*.tbn" -exec rm {} \;
4) The Future Better integration with XBMC library. (in alpha) This has proved difficult due to incomplete guide information currently provided by eyetv. More Infolabels More sorting options Fanart (in alpha) nfo file support (in alpha) Live TV Buffer support
5) Notes Sometimes XBMC caches thumbnails and icons so your changes, especially with TOG, might not be immediately apparent. I don't really have a good solution for this other then recommend you remove those .tbn's directly from the thumbnail cache. Perhaps the cache will periodically update, I'm not entirely certain, I'm open to ideas.
Eyetv is a trademark of Elgato

entry.title: XBMC Eyetv Scraper
entry.author: prophead
entry.description_en:
XES (XBMCEyetvScraper) is a video plug-in for XBMC to view your Eyetv library from XBMC's video menu with the meta data, icons and thumbnails from Eyetv without eyetvsched files or the live tv buffer, and parse thetvdb for epg data, and attempt to build a subdirectory of symbolic links, nfo files, banners, and fanart to support XBMC's library mode.
I recommend you install XES in parallel with XEP (XBMCEyetvParser); Because XES takes a long time to scrape thetvdb epg data I recommend you only use it only when you need to refresh your TV Shows directory with new files from Eyetv. XEP for quick viewing of current Eyetv shows, XES to periodically create/update your TV Shows symbolic links directory. You can then choose to view your TV Shows symbolic links directory in files or library mode after the files are scanned.
The files you see after running XES are the same as the files you see from XEP, with the Eyetv EPG data, use the TV Shows directory to see thetvdb EPG data.
1) Installation A) XBMC http://xbmc.org/wiki/?title=Plugins#XBMC_for_Mac_plugin_directories http://xbmc.org/wiki/?title=Plugins#Adding_plugins_sources_in_XBMC_GUI Set your Eyetv directory and TV Shows placeholder directory by pressing 'c' for context menu on the XBMCEyetvScraper plugin, then choose Plugin Settings Add your TV Shows directory of symbolic links as a new source after you run XES
B) Boxee http://boxee-plugins.blogspot.com/2008/12/installing-plugins-for-boxee.html 1) Copy the XBMCEyetvScraper directory to /Applications/Boxee.app/Contents/Resources/Boxee/plugins/video/ 2) Edit /Applications/Boxee.app/Contents/Resources/Boxee/plugins/video/XBMCEyetvScraper/default.py to choose features. 3) Run Boxee 4) Choose Settings 5) Choose add media source 6) Choose add application source 7) Choose XBMCEyetvScraper 8) Select Video and Private checkboxes 9) Hit ESC to back up to the settings menu 10) Choose Application Settings 11) Set your Eyetv Directory and TV Shows links directory 12) ESC back to the main menu, the plugin is now ready to use 13)Add your TV Shows directory of symbolic links as a new non-private local media source from the Settings/Media Sources menu after you run XES. Add your TV Shows directory of symbolic links as a new source after you run XES
2) Use A) XBMC Select XBMCEyetvScraper or the TV Show directory (after use) from the videos menu Browse and select your video to play or hit 'c' to bring up the context menu and choose information to see more EPG data B) Boxee Select XBMCEyetvScraper from the video/Internet Sources menu Browse and select your video to play or choose video/TV Shows
3) Advanced Use A) TOG XES now has integrated TOG (Thumbnail Overlay Generator) but it's disabled by default. To enable it hit 'c' to bring up the context menu on the plugin, then toggle TOG to on (Boxee users choose Application Settings from the Settings menu. Edit XBMCEyetvScraper/default.py for your locations of the required Imagemagick and Ffmpeg, defaults are to the standard macports locations. To install these packages, first install macports, then from the terminal, sudo port install Imagemagick; sudo port install ffmpeg; The first time you use the XES plug with TOG enabled it will take a while to generate the new (small size) thumbnails with overlays for your current Eyetv library. Subsequent use will be very fast due to preexisting XBMC .tbn files. Very small .tbn jpeg files will get created in your eyetv video packages, but it will not alter any original files, or impact regular Eyetv use in any way. If you would like to remove these files the easiest way to do this is from the terminal, find /path/to/eyetv/folder -name "*.tbn" -exec rm {} \;
B) LDS XEP now has limited library support. LDS will create a directory (specify in XBMCEyetvScraper/default.py) and then populate that directory with symbolic links in the format XBMC library expects for TV shows. You can then add that directory as a new source and set content on it to add it to the library. Feel free to change the symbolic link names to better suit your scraper. C) NFO XEP now has limited .nfo file support, LDS is required to be on for .nfo files to work. Setting this will use the scrape epg data from thetvdb. Very small .nfo files will get created in your links directory, but it will not alter any original files. If you would like to remove these files the easiest way to do this is just to throw the TVShow folder of symbolic links in the trash and let XES create fresh one. 4) The Future More GUI settings More Infolabels More sorting options Live TV Buffer support EDL lists from Eyetv Plist files (commercial skipping)
5) Notes Sometimes XBMC caches thumbnails and icons so your changes, especially with TOG, might not be immediately apparent. I don't really have a good solution for this other then recommend you remove those .tbn's directly from the thumbnail cache. Perhaps the cache will periodically update, I'm not entirely certain, I'm open to ideas.
Eyetv is a trademark of Elgato

entry.title: Tiki Bar TV
entry.author: exiledx
entry.description_en:
Videos from website www.tikibartv.com Tiki Bar TV: Tiki Bar TV is a short video series distributed in the pioneering field of video podcasting or "vodcast." Produced in an apartment Tiki bar on a low budget, the humorous and heavily ad-libbed show is a creative outlet for its creators Jeff Macpherson and Kevin Gamble. The show garnered additional attention after being mentioned at Apple's iPod Video launch.[1] Each episode features a problem that is rectified by the episode's namesake cocktail, which is scribbled on a prescription pad by Dr. Tiki (Macpherson) and "filled" by the bartender Johnny Johnny (Gamble) who explains the construction of the cocktail. Lala is the Tiki Bar's primary denizen who opens each episode with a dance. Most episodes also include a segment called "Tiki Mail," where mail from viewers or disgruntled neighbours is answered. Episodes usually end with outtakes, the cast dancing, and a slate giving the official website and email address. The show originates from Vancouver, British Columbia in Canada.
Tiki Bar TV was shown in Apple stores worldwide as part of a 6 month promotion in 2006.

It turned out to be a bit tricky (for me at least) in that episodes are broken up into segments rather than single streams. So to watch a full episode in boxee you'd have to play the first 5-10 minute segment, select the next segment and play it, then the next, etc. I opted to go a different route which basically makes a video playlist of the segments and plays them in succession but this causes a few issues:
-Watched episodes don't show up in your profile stream. -When you select an episode you don't get a "Play, Read more" screen. It just starts playing.
entry.description_en:
This plugin created for Boxee by thecheese allow to watch video on www.adultswim.com
Additionnal information: Caution: you need to be in the US in order to watch the videos
It turned out to be a bit tricky (for me at least) in that episodes are broken up into segments rather than single streams. So to watch a full episode in boxee you'd have to play the first 5-10 minute segment, select the next segment and play it, then the next, etc. I opted to go a different route which basically makes a video playlist of the segments and plays them in succession but this causes a few issues:
-Watched episodes don't show up in your profile stream. -When you select an episode you don't get a "Play, Read more" screen. It just starts playing.

entry.title: TED Talks
entry.author: rwparris2
entry.description_en:
Allows to watch video on ted.org
Features: Browse All, Browse by Theme, Plugin Settings (highlight the plugin, open context menu) allows you to set your preference to 480p HD videos, regular SD videos, or Audio. If you set set it to something other than SD video while browsing by theme, it will still show you ALL videos available, and then it will try to play it in the format you requested. If it can't find an audio stream or HD stream, it will just play the regular SD video instead.

entry.title: NetFlix RSS Reader
entry.author: rwparris2
entry.description_en:
No videos, just Title and Plot from RSS feed. Listed as a video plugin but can be installed into any plugin folder.
Instructions: You have to manually insert your netflix id via the plugin settings (highlight plugin, context menu, settings) You're looking for this: http://rss.netflix.com/AtHomeRSS?[B]id=P0000000000000000000000000000000[/B] Put the bolded part in there. If you don't want to do it through the gui, you can open the plugin folder>resources>settings.xml and set your number to the default.

entry.title: Youtube Channels
entry.author: afishe2000
entry.description_en:
YouTube plugin to play selected channels.
To edit the channels you need to edit default.py.
Add any YouTube Channel you want...
addChannel('name', 'channel')
http://www.youtube.com/user/FoodNetworkTV - channel = FoodNetworkTV
addChannel('Food Network TV', 'FoodNetworkTV')
------------------------------------------------------
addChannel('Food Network TV', 'FoodNetworkTV') addChannel('Indian Food', 'vahchef') addChannel('Show Me The Curry', 'ShowMeTheCurry') addChannel('UKTV Food', 'UKTVFoodChannel') addChannel('Food Wishes','foodwishes') addChannel('Cooking 75','cooking75') addChannel('Maangchi','Maangchi') addChannel('Indian Food Recipes', 'IndianFoodRecipes')
------------------------------------------------------
Available Plugin Settings: None

entry.title: Wixi Video
entry.author: runa
entry.description_en:
[B]WHAT'S WIXI?[/B]
[B]Upload and backup your media with no limits:[/B] Upload your media collections: photos, videos and favorite songs and also large document, spreadsheets, pdfs or zip files to your online desktop.
[B]Play files from anywhere[/B] Access your media files and playlists no matter where you are, just with an Internet connection, no need to carry any USB key or heavy hard-drive.
[B]Share it with your friends[/B] Your media files are meant to be shared: with your friends, family, colleagues or to the world! Send your media files and playlists to your friends ... even if they are not on Wixi!
[B]Mobile access to your media[/B] Wixi also works in the palm of your hand, with your mobile phone letting you search, play and download any public media file.
[B]Install and run Wixi[/B] First of all you will need a Wixi account (www.wixi.com). Wixi is available for pictures, music and video. You will need to go in each corresponding section of the Installer Passion-XBMC and install each plugin separately. Once installed, go in the section you wwant (pictures, music or video) and select Wixi plugin and display context menu. Then select Plugin Settings and type your user and password. Hit OK and then click on Wixi. Your folder structure will load and you will be able to enjoy your medias!
